author: jerenkrantz
msg: APRized version of testdate.  This is from my patch from a long
time ago posted to new-httpd.  There seems to be some subtle bugs that
need to be tracked down.  My guess is the bug might be within testdate.
% ./testdate | grep "^No "

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Moved from httpd-2.0 without any changes
httpd-2.0/test/test_date.c --> test/testdate.c
Obtained from: Apache httpd 2.0.18

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Blind attempt to add apr_date to the VC++ files.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: APR-utilize the date functions from httpd-2.0.  Add it to the
build system, etc.  Reformat the apr_date code to follow the style
guidelines (old, old patch I submitted).
Add the date parsing functions from mod_mbox (apr_parseRFCdate).
Yes, this takes a char * not a const char * because it could
potentially modify the incoming char *.  Ugly, but the only way to
parse some invalid dates is to tweak the string at a particular
stage.  If someone has time, they can rewrite the apr_parseRFCdate
function to be better at this and take in a const char *.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Copied from httpd-2.0 without any changes
httpd-2.0/include/util_date.h       --> include/apr_date.h
httpd-2.0/server/util_date.c        --> misc/apr_date.c
